  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: While a QA was doing a morning dock walk, he noticed a tote with some wet packages, he gets close and he found out that one was a hazmat. DescribePack: When I start working on the package, I thought that was only stain from the other damages packages in the tote, but when I opened, I noticed that the bottle got loose cap and more than half was leaked out. DurationRel: 11 and MitigateEffect: QA brought the package to QA processing cage, we put it in a tote line with a hazmat bag.

item.title: Report X-2023060961
item.description:
Report X-2023060961

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-13T21:09:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-06
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: WHILE THE PACKAGE HANDLER WAS UNLOADING THE TRAILER, THEY NOTICED THIS PACKAGE WAS LEAKING AND REPORTED IT TO THEIR MANAGER. THE MANAGER QUICKLY INFORMED QA OF THE SITUATION. QA GRABBED A TOTE AND LINED IT WITH A CLEAR, LARGE HAZMAT BAG ALONG WITH SOME LOOSE ABSORB. THEY QUICKLY RUSHED OVER TO THE AREA AND NOTICED THIS PACKAGE HAD A STRONG ODOR TO IT AND NOTICED IT HAD NO MARKINGS ON THE OUTSIDE. QA BROUGHT THE PACKAGE BACK TO QA AFTER THEY CLEANED UP THE SPILL. ONCE THEY GOT BACK TO QA, THEY PLACED IT IN THE HAZMAT PROCESSING CAGE. DescribePack: ONE OF THE CANS IS DENTED NEAR THE BOTTOM OF IT FROM IT BEING HIT BY ANOHTER CAN. CAUSING IT TO RUPTURE AND SPILL OUT. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A TOTE LINED WITH A CLEAR, LARGE HAZMAT BAG AND CLEANED UP WITH LOOSE ABSROB.

item.title: Report X-2023060692
item.description:
Report X-2023060692

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-13T21:09:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-06
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PACKAGE WAS PICKED UP OFF OUTBOUND IRREG TABLE, LOADER NOTICED THAT PACKAGE HAD SOLID MATERIAL SPILLING OUT OF THE CORNER. LOADER PLACED THE PACKAGE DOWN, STEPPED AWAY FROM THE AREA AND CONTACTED DESIGNATED RESPONDER. OUTSIDE RESPONDER WAS CONTACTED DUE TO THE PACKAGE BEING 1.4 EXPLOSIVE. OUTSIDE RESPONDER DISCOVERED THAT THE INTERNAL PACKAGING HAD A MISSING CAP.

item.title: Report X-2023060691
item.description:
Report X-2023060691

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-13T21:09:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-06
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SUPERVISOR DISCOVERED PACKAGE LEAKING IN DOOR AND RADIO DMP FOR A RESPONDER. RESPONDER WAS DISPATCHED WITH FULL PPE AND FULL SPILL CART. RESPONDER ARRIVED AND USED THE DECISION TREE TO DETERMINE THE APPROIATE STEPS TO FOLLOW. RESPONDER FOLLOWED STEPS AS HE WAS TRAINED TOO APPROIATLY CLEAN UP THE SPILL. SPILL WAS CLEANED UP AND THE PACKAGE AND MATERIALS WERE BROUGHT BACK TO DMP FOR PROPER DISPOSAL.

item.title: Report X-2023060575
item.description:
Report X-2023060575

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-13T21:09:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-31
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: WHEN THE MANAGER OPENED THE TRAILER, THEY NOTICED THIS PACKAGE WAS DAMAGED AND CALLED QA OVER. QA BROUGHT A TOTE LINED WITH A HAZMAT BAG AND LOOSE ABSORB. THEY NOTICED THIS PACKAGE WAS LOADED IMPROPERLY AND LEAKED OUT. THEY PLACED THE PACKAGE IN THE TOTE AND CLEANED UP THE AREA WITH THE LOOSE ABSORB. ONCE IT WAS CLEANED AND SAFE TO UNLOAD AGAIN, QA BROUGHT THE PACKAGE BACK TO QA AND PLACED IN THE HAZMAT PROCESSING CAGE. DescribePack: TWO OF THE LIDS WERE FOUND OFF OF THE CANS AND THE CONTENTS LEAKED OUT. ALSO DISCOVERED THE PACKAGE HAD A HAZMAT FLAMMABLE LABEL ON THE OUTSIDE, BUT THE LABEL ITSELF WAS A PPD LABEL AND NOT A HAZMAT SHIPPING LABEL. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A TOTE WITH A LINED HAZMAT BAG. THE CONTENTS WERE CLEANED UP WITH SOME LOOSE ABSORB.

QA PLACED THE PACKAGE IN A LINED TOTE AND CLEANED UP THE SPILL. THE PACKAGE WAS THEN TAKEN TO THE PROCESSING CAGE. DescribePack: THE CONTAINER WAS LEAKING OUT FROM AROUND THE CAP AND SOILED THE BOX. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A LINED TOTE. 2. X-2023060528 SequenceEvent: PACKAGE HANDLER NOTICED THE LEAKING PACKAGE AND NOTIFIED THE MANAGER THE MANAGER THEN NOTIFIED QA. QA PLACED THE PACKAGE IN A LINED TOTE AND CLEANED UP THE SPILL. AFTER THE SPILL WAS CLEAN THE PACKAGE WAS TAKEN TO THE PROCESSING CAGE. DescribePack: THE CONTAINER WAS LEAKING OUT FROM AROUND THE CAP AND SOILED THE PACKAGE. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A LINED TOTE.

item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-13T21:09:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-02
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XKC experienced a UN3149 Oximycin P5 release from a 5-gallon poly drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-gallon of product released to a 2' x 2' area of the trailer floor due to the vented cap leaking as a result of the pail falling in transit. Absorbents and neutralizer were deployed and worked into the impacted area. All cleanup debris was collected into a vented 55-gallon poly drum. The jugs were re-stacked and secured to a pallet for shipment on. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: XPO Logistics Terminal XKC experienced a release from a 520-pound Dewar. ERTS dispatched contractors to inspect the freight. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed one Dewar containing UN1963 Refrigerated Helium fell over inside the trailer causing the pressure relief valve to activate. The Dewar was up righted and the pressure relief valve was shut off and confirmed to be no longer off gassing. Crew re-secured the Dewar and some surrounding cylinders that shifted. No waste was generated

  • Description: SequenceEvent: THE PACKAGE HANDLER LOADING THE TRAILER NOTICED THIS PACKAGE WAS LEAKING SOME CONTENTS AND NOTIFIED THEIR MANAGER. THE MANAGER INFORMED QA OF THE SITUATION AND SET THE PACKAGE ASIDE. QA BROUGHT WENT OVER TO THE AREA TO RETRIEVE THE PACKAGE AND BROUGHT IT BACK TO QA. THEY HAD OPENED THE PACKAGE AND DISCOVERED THE CONTENTS INSIDE THE PACKAGE WERE INFACT CORROSIVE MATERIAL. THEY PLACED THE PACKAGE IN THE HAZMAT PROCESSING CAGE. DescribePack: ONE OF THE CAPS HAS A CRACKED LID FROM THE PACKAGE BEING DROPPED. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A TOTE WITH A CLEAR, LARGE HAZMAT BAG.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Truck and a bulk tanker containing a load of UN1993 Flammable Liquid was in route from Corpus Christi TX to Fredonia KS. While in route the truck ran off of the road which resulted in a rollover. As a result of the rollover, there was a very small drip from the dome lid on the tanker. There was also a small spill of motor oil that came from the truck engine. Local Fire Department and state police reported to the scene. Also, an emergency response and remediation crew was dispatched to the scene for cleanup, remediation and load transfer. The load was successfully transferred to another truck and transported on to the original destination. The site was cleaned and contaminated soil was disposed of properly.

  • Description: IAPX 1033 was reported to be releasing product in the UPRR 18th Street Yard. Inspection of the car found product coming from the left side valve box. Upon opening the valve box doors, product was found to be coming from the liquid line cap as the liquid line valve was unsecured and open slightly. The valve was closed, stopping the release and the valve handle was resecured to prevent it from opening again. No remediation was required as the product all evaporated.

item.title: Report X-2023030777
item.description:
Report X-2023030777

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-13T21:09:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-03-15
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: THE AREA MANAGER NOTICED THIS PACKAGE LEAKING IN THE TRAILER AND CALLED QA OVER TO TAKE CARE OF THE HAZMAT. QA RUSHED OVER TO THE AREA TO INVESTIGATE. UPON ARRIVAL, QA NOTICED THE PACKAGE WAS LOADED UPSIDE DOWN IN THE TRAILER AND LEAKING OUT. QA CALLED OVER THE AREA MANGAER AND THE SORT MANAGER TO LET THEM KNOW TO PULL THE TRAILER OFF AND MOVE IT CLOSER TO QA SO THEY CAN CLEAN UP THE AREA SAFELY. ONCE THE TRAILER WAS ON THE QA DOOR, QA PLACED THE PACKAGE IN THE RED TOTE WHICH WAS LINED WITH A CLEAR, LARGE HAZMAT BAG AND PLACED NEUTRALIZER AND FOLD ABSORB DOWN TO CLEAN UP THE AREA. ONCE IT WAS CLEAN AND SAFE, QA PLACED A LOAD NET UP AND THE TRAILER GOT BUMPED BACK OVER TO THE OUTBOUND DOOR TO KEEP GETTING LOADED DOWN. DescribePack: THE PACKAGE WAS LOADED UPSIDE DOWN ON THE LEFT SIDE OF THE TRAILER WHICH LED TO ONE OF THE BOTTLES LEAKING OUT THRU THE CAPS. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A TOTE LINED WITH A CLEAR HAZMAT BAG AND CLEANED UP WITH NEUTRALIZER AND FOLD ABSORB.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: WHILE A PACKAGE HANDLER WAS UNLOADING THE TRAILER, THEY NOTICED A STRONG ODOR COMING FROM THE TRAILER AND INFORMED THEIR MANAGER. THE MANAGER INFORMED QA OF THE SITUATION. QA GRABBED A TOTE WITH A LINED HAZMAT BAG AND GRABBED FLAT ABSORB. THEY RUSHED OVER TO THE UNLOAD AND NOTICED THE STRONG ODOR. QA FOUND THE LEAKING HAZMAT AND PLACED IN THE TOTE. QA CLEANED UP THE AREA WITH THE FOLD ABSROB AND NEUTRALIZER. ONCE IT WAS SAFE, THEY BROUGHT THE PACKAGE BACK TO QA AND PLACED IN THE HAZMAT PROCESSING CAGE. DescribePack: THE BOTTLES ARE CRACKED ON THE BOTTOM SIDE. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A TOTE LINED WITH A HAZMAT BAG.

item.title: Report E-2023030166
item.description:
Report E-2023030166

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-13T21:09:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-02-28
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XKC experienced a NA1993 "SPEC-AID 8Q123ULS" release from a 275-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 4-gallons of product released to a 2’ x 3’ area of the trailer floor and 3' x 5' area of the asphalt lot below the trailer due to a puncture on the top corner of the tote. The product was transferred from the damaged tote into a new one and absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted areas. The damaged tote was then cut up and containerized along with all impacted absorbents and cleanup debris into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023030075
item.description:
Report E-2023030075

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-13T21:09:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-02-03
  • City: WICHITA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Haz-Mat Response Inc. (HMRI) was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 2ft- by-6ft area of the trailer floor and estimated that two (2) gallons of material was released. HMRI personnel neutralized the impacted area and used granular absorbents to collect the material. The spent absorbents and debris were placed into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum and the damaged jugs and product was placed into an additional 55-gallon poly drum. Both drums were staged onsite at the terminal prior to the contractor demobilizing.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: WHILE A PACKAGE HANDLER WAS LOADING THE TRAILER, THEY NOTICED THIS PACKAGE WAS WET AND INFORMED THEIR MANAGER. THE MANAGER QUICKLY INFORMED QA OF THE SITUATION. QA GRABBED A TOTE AND RUSHED OVER TO THE AREA TO INVESTIGATE. UPON ARRIVAL, THEY NOTICED THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A TOTE. THEY MADE SURE THE AREA WAS CLEAN AND SAFE. QA BROUGHT THE PACKAGE BACK TO QA AND PLACED IN THE HAZMAT PROCESSING CAGE. DescribePack: THE PACKAGE WAS LOADED ON ITS SIDE AND CAUSED THE CONTENTS TO LEAK OUT THRU THE CAPS. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A TOTE.

THE RESPONDER TRANSPORTED THE MATERIAL TO DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. UPON ARRIVAL RESPONDER NOTED THAT ONE CAR BATTERY WAS LEAKING FROM A CRACK IN THE SIDE. ALL CONTAMINATED DEBRIS WAS DISPOSED OF THOUGH DMP. THE CAR BATTERY WAS DISPOSED OF THOUGH OUTSIDE VENDOR.

item.title: Report E-2023020145
item.description:
Report E-2023020145

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-13T21:09:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-01-09
  • City: WICHITA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: LIQUID TRANSPORT CORP
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On January 9, 2023, Dana Companies contacted ERTS regarding an Organic Peroxide release that occurred at 0702 ET near the intersection of West 47th Street and South Water St. in Wichita, KS. It was advised that 50-200 gallons of product released to a ditch line near a railroad crossing due to a valve being left open. At 1048 EST, Haz-mat Response arrived onsite and confirmed 100 gallons had released from the tanker for approximately one mile in distance. It was advised the 1 mile of impact had been tracked through and appeared to be mostly dried up. The primary impact area had product pooled approximately 150ft in front and behind the trailer. The crew began applying absorbents. Haz-Mat Response advised there was no evidence of product in any drains. Haz-Mat completed operations and departed the site with (8) eight 55-gallon poly drums of impacted clay. Waste is stille pending disposal.

item.title: Report X-2023010419
item.description:
Report X-2023010419

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-13T21:09:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-01-06
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: WHILE THE PACKAGE HANDLER WAS UNLOADING THE TRAILER, THEY SAW THIS PACKAGE LEAKING ON ITS SIDE AND PLACED IN A TOTE AND MOVED IT ACROSS THE BELT. QA WAS CALLED OUT BY THE MANAGER ABOUT THE LEAKING HAZMAT. QA RUSHED OVER TO THE AREA AND NOTICED THE PACKAGE WAS MOVED ACROSS THE BELT. THEY HAD INFORMED THE PACKAGE HANDLER TO MAKE SURE NOT TO MOVE THE PACKAGE FOR THEIR SAFETY. QA CLEANED UP WHERE THE PACAKGE WAS AT BECAUSE THERE WAS SOME SUBSTANCE ON THE GROUND. ONCE THE AREA WAS CLEANED, QA BROUGHT THE PACKAGE TO QA AND PLACED IN THE HAZMAT PROCESSING CAGE. DescribePack: THE PACKAGE WAS LOADED ON ITS SIDE, WHICH LED TO THE CONTENTS LEAKING OUT THRU THE CAP. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A TOTE LINED WITH A BAG AND THE AREA WAS CLENAED UP WITH NEUTRALIZER AND FOLD ABSORB.

item.title: Report E-2022120535
item.description:
Report E-2022120535

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-13T21:09:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-12-14
  • City: WICHITA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Terminal XWK called in to report a 5-gallon spill of UN3266 "ALC #1 NF" from a 300-gallon poly tote caused by a forklift puncture. The released material impacted the trailer floor and the asphalt below it. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 15-gallons of product released to a 28' x 6' area of the trailer, a 30' x 20' area tracked around the dock, and a 20' x 4' area under the trailer due to a puncture. The material was transferred into a new tote. Absorbents were worked into the impacted areas. The damaged tote was cut up and containerized along with all cleanup debris into three 55-gallon metal drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At 0301 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal XKC. It was reported that approximately 2 gallons of UN1903 "SANI-T-10 PLUS" was released from a 5 gallon plastic jug due to improper blocking and bracing. The release impacted trailer floor. ERTS dispatched a contractor to the site to complete cleanup activities. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2-gallons of product released to a 1' x 10' area of the trailer floor due to the pallet of pails tipping over. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted area. The two damaged pails and all cleanup debris were collected and containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum which was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At 0819 ET, XPO terminal XWK contacted ERTS to report a spill that occurred on the dock at 0801 E, in Wichita, KS. The spill consisted of (1) 50-pound plastic bag of Lithium Hydroxide, which was torn at the bottom of the pallet by another pallet with loose debris from an adjacent pallet during dock operations, releasing approximately 3 cups onto the floor. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and advised approximately 3 cups of the product released to a 2' x 2' area of the dock floor. The damaged bag was containerized into a 5-gallon poly drum and all released product was collected into a separate 5-gallon poly drum. All waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

ERTS dispatched a contractor to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2-cups of product released to a 1' x 1' area of the trailer floor due to a pallet puncture. The damaged bag, released product, and cleanup debris were containerized along into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

ONCE IT WAS SAFE AND SECURE, THEY BROUGHT IT BACK AND PLACED IN THE HAZMAT PROCESSING CAGE. DescribePack: THE CAPS CAME LOOSE WHEN THE PACKAGE WAS DROPPED. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A TOTE WITH A LINED HAZMAT BAG AND CLEANED UP WITH NEUTRALIZER AND FOLD ABSORB.

item.title: Report X-2022100983
item.description:
Report X-2022100983

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-13T21:09:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-10-05
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: WHILE THE PACKAGE HANDLER WAS PICKING OFF THE IC BELT, THEY NOTICED THIS PACKAGE LEAKING AND MOVED IT INTO A BLACK TOTE. THE PACKAGE HANDLER INFORMED THEIR MANAGER OF THE LEAKING HAZMAT. QA RUSHED OVER TO THE AREA WITH FOLD ABSORB, A TOTE LINED WITH A HAZMAT BAG AND NEUTRALIZER. THEY NOTICED THE PACKAGE HAD BEEN MOVED INTO A TOTE AND PLACED THE PACKAGE IN THE TOTE WITH THE LINED HAZMAT BAG. QA CLEANED UP THE AREA WITH THE NEUTRALIZER AND BROUGHT THE PACKAGE BACK TO QA AND PLACED IN THE HAZMAT PROCESSING CAGE. DescribePack: THE PACKAGE WAS UNLOADED ONTO ITS SIDE AND CAUSED THE CONTENTS TO LEAK OUT THRU THE CAP. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A TOTE LINED WITH A HAZMAT BAG AND CLEANED UP WITH FOLD ABSORB AND NEUTRALIZER.

item.title: Report I-2022120082
item.description:
Report I-2022120082

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-13T21:09:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-09-29
  • City: Wichita
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: DURING THE PM SORT OPERATIONS AT THE FEDEX EXPRESS SORT FACILITY IN WICHITA, KS A FIBERBOARD BOX WAS OBSERVED TO POTENTIALLY CONTAIN UNDECLARED DG. FURTHER INVESTIGATION INDICATED THE BOX CONTAINED A CYLINDER OF UN3337 REFRIGERANT GAS TECHNICAL NAME TETRAFLUOROETHANE, TRIFLUOROETHANE & PENTAFLUROETHANE. THERE WERE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKINGS OR LABELS ON THE PACKAGING, AND NO SHIPPERS DECLARATION FOR DANGEROUS GOODS WAS OFFERED WITH THE SHIPMENT. FOLLOWING SPILL CLEANUP, THE INVOLVED PACKAGE WAS PLACED INSIDE OF A SALVAGE DRUM AND HELP PENDING FURTHER DISPOSITION INSTRUCTIONS.

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-13T21:09:52+00:00

  • City: DODGE CITY
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Driver discovered that the exterior package was wet. Driver requested package be inspected. Upon unloading of van, package was placed in lined red tote and inspected. It was determined that the interior steel drum was dented near the base and that there was a puncture. The drum was placed in hazmat bag and placed in salvage drum and sealed. Loose absorption material was used just as a precaution should there be any more leakage. DescribePack: The steel drum was dented near base and there was a small puncture. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The drum was placed in hazmat bag and placed in salvage drum and sealed. Loose absorption material was used just as a precaution should there be any more leakage.

item.title: Report X-2022100675
item.description:
Report X-2022100675

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-13T21:09:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-09-22
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: WHILE THE PACKAGE HANDLER WAS UNLOADING THE TRAILER, THE PACKAGE WAS ON THE CONVEYOR BELT AND FELL OFF AND ONTO THE FLOOR. THEY NOTICED THE PACKAGE WAS LEAKING AND INFORMED THEIR MANAGER. THE MANAGER QUICKLY INFORMED QA OF THE SITUATION. QA GRABBED A RED TOTE LINED WITH A CLEAR, LARGE HAZMAT BAG AND FOLD ABSORB WITH NEUTRALIZER. THEY RUSHED OVER TO THE UNLOAD TO INVESTIGATE THE SITUATION. THEY NOTICED THE PACKAGE IN QUESTION WAS CORROSIVE AND WAS SITTING ON TOP OF THE GRATES. THEY PLACED NEUTRALIZER ON THE AREA AND PLACED THE PACKAGE IN THE RED TOTE. ONCE THE AREA WAS SAFE, THEY BROUGHT THE PACKAGE BACK TO QA AND PLACED IN THE HAZMAT PROCESSING CAGE. DescribePack: THE CONTAINER IS CRACKED ON THE BOTTOM CORNER FROM THE PACKAGE FALLING OFF THE BELT. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A RED HAZMAT TOTE LINED WITH A HAZMAT BAG AND NEUTRALIZER WAS PLACED ON THE FLOOR.

item.description:

  • City: OLATHE
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On September 30, 2022, one (1) 55-gallon drum of printing ink was punctured by a forklift and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC, who dispatched a crew from Environmental Restoration (ER) to perform the necessary corrective actions. ER personnel utilized a pallet jack to clear the non-impacted cargo and containerized the damaged drum into one (1) 85-gallon overpack. ER then utilized absorbents and hand tools to further remediate the impacted surface and containerized all ink-impacted material into one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2022090396
item.description:
Report E-2022090396

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-13T21:09:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-09-07
  • City: WICHITA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At 0440 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal XWK. It was reported that approximately 1 cup of UN 2031 "Membrane Acid 100" was released from 330 gallon poly tote due to a possible leak in the valve. The release impacted the dock floor. ERTS dispatched Haz-Mat Response for cleanup. At 0729 ET, HMR personnel arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1 cup of product released to a 1' x 1' area of plywood on the dock floor due to a faulty valve. The product was transferred out of the damaged tote and into a new one. The damaged tote was then cut up and containerized into a 55 gallon poly drum which was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Description: SequenceEvent: WHILE QA WAS DOING THEIR DOCK WALK, THEY SAW THIS PACKAGE UNDERNEATH THE BELT WET. THEY GRABBED A TOTE LINED WITH A CLEAR, LARGE HAZMAT BAG. QA WENT OVER TO THE OUTBOUND AREA AND PLACED THE PACKAGE IN THE TOTE. ONCE IT WAS SECURE, THEY BROUGT THE PACKAGE BACK TO QA AND PLACED IT IN THE PROCESSING CAGE. DescribePack: THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED ON THE IC BELT IMPROPERLY. IT WAS PLACED ON ITS SIDE AND CAUSED THE CONTENTS TO LEAK OUT THRU THE CAPS. DurationRel: 8 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A TOTE LINED WITH A CLEAR, LARGE HAZMAT BAG AND BROUGHT BACK TO QA.

item.description:

  • Incident Date: 2022-08-03
  • City: LENEXA

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: THE PACKAGE GOT TO THE END OF THE IC BELT AND FELL OFF OF THE ROLLERS. THE MANAGER NOTICED THE ISSUE AND NOTIFIED QA. QA GRABBED LOOSE ABSORB AND TWO TOTES WITH LINED HAZMAT BAGS AND RUSHED OVER TO THE AREA. THEY PLACED THE PACKAGE IN THE TOTE AND NOTICED IT WAS A CORROSIVE HAZMAT. QA CLEANED UP THE AREA WITH LOOSE ABSORB AND NEUTRALIZER. ONCE IT WAS SAFE, THEY BROUGHT IT BACK AND PLACED IT IN THE HAZMAT PROCESSING CAGE. DescribePack: THE PACKAGE FELL OFF OF THE IC BELT AND CRACKED THE TOP OF THE LID. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A TOTE WITH A LINED HAZMAT BAG AND CLEANED UP WITH NEUTRALIZER AND LOOSE ABSORB.
